trans-unit.source: Provides the managed definition of the `IPersistFile` interface, with functionality from `IPersist`.
For more information, see the existing documentation for `IPersistFile` and `IPersist` in the MSDN library.
The common language runtime throws an exception when a COM method in native code returns an HRESULT.
For more information, see [How to: Map HRESULTs and Exceptions](~/docs/framework/interop/how-to-map-hresults-and-exceptions.md).
Retrieves the class identifier (CLSID) of an object.
For more information, see the existing documentation for `IPersist::GetClassID` in the MSDN library.
When this method returns, contains a reference to the CLSID.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Retrieves either the absolute path to the current working file of the object or, if there is no current working file, the default file name prompt of the object.
For more information, see the existing documentation for `IPersistFile::GetCurFile` in the MSDN library.
When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a zero-terminated string containing the path for the current file, or the default file name prompt (such as *.txt).
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Checks an object for changes since it was last saved to its current file.
For more information, see the existing documentation for `IPersistFile::IsDirty` in the MSDN library.
`S_OK` if the file has changed since it was last saved; `S_FALSE` if the file has not changed since it was last saved.
Opens the specified file and initializes an object from the file contents.
The `STGM` enumeration is not part of the .NET Framework, but is documented in the MSDN library.
For more information, see the existing documentation for `IPersistFile::Load` in the MSDN library.
A zero-terminated string containing the absolute path of the file to open.
A combination of values from the `STGM` enumeration to indicate the access mode in which to open pszFileName.
Saves a copy of the object into the specified file.
For more information, see the existing documentation for `IPersistFile::Save` in the MSDN library.
A zero-terminated string containing the absolute path of the file to which the object is saved.
`true` to used the pszFileName parameter as the current working file; otherwise `false`.
Notifies the object that it can write to its file.
For more information, see the existing documentation for `IPersistFile::SaveCompleted` in the MSDN library.
The absolute path of the file where the object was previously saved.
